titles: By the King. A proclamation for the better government of His Majesties army and for the preventing the plundring, spoyling, and robbing of His Majesties subjects, under any pretense whatsoever, upon pain of the punishments herein declared.
author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I)
Charles I, King of England, 1600-1649.
notes: In this edition the 7th line of text begins with: "that".
At foot of page: "Given at Our court at Reading, the 25 day of November, in the eighteenth yeer of Our raign. God save the King."
With engraving including royal seal at head of document.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
keywords: Great Britain --  Militia --  Early works to 1800.
Great Britain --  History --  Civil War, 1642-1649 --  Confiscations and contributions --  Early works to 1800.
